fields.summary: Android: borderRadius does not adhere to defaultunit
fields.environment:
SDK/CLI 3.1.2.GA
Android 4.1.2 on Samsung Galaxy S2

comments.body:
Use the default unit for radius.

https://github.com/appcelerator/titanium_mobile/pull/5310

borderRadius responds to the default unit defined in tiapp.xml 
as <property name="ti.ui.defaultunit" type="string">dp</property>
borderRadius is rendered same for both android and iOS platform.

Verified the fix, hence closing the issue

Environment used:
Device : Google Nexus 5,  Android Version: 4.4.2
Device : iPhone 5s , iOS version : 7.1
SDK: 3.2.3.v20140325145222
CLI version : 3.2.3-dev
OS : MAC OSX 10.9.2
Alloy:  1.3.1
ACS: 1.0.14
npm:1.3.2
Appcelerator Studio, build: 3.2.3.201403250634
titanium-code-processor: 1.1.0
XCode : 5.1

Guys, this issue is not solved. Or if it was, then here it is crawling back in from the deads.

I am using SDK 5.3.1 and it exists also on SDK 5.4.

We have even tried to pass the value using something similar to the following ...


{code:java}
borderRadius: isAndroid ? require('alloy/measurement').dpToPX(40) : 40
{code}

... but it has an erratic behaviour from one Android to another.

The result is exactly similar to the screen capture provided by Fokke Zandbergen.

Wow, that is another bug here in the jira site. It destroyed a simple javascript line that was supposed to look like ...

{color:#8eb021}borderRadius: isAndroid ? require('alloy/measurement').dpToPX(40) : 40{color}
